what: Bayesian categorical factor analysis using Rcpp
title: Bayesian categorical factor analysis using Rcpp
text: fatcat package provides interface fit factor models categorical data, described Capdeville, Gonçalves Pereira (2021).

title: Bayesian categorical factor analysis using Rcpp
text: can install development version fatcat GitHub :

title: Bayesian categorical factor analysis using Rcpp
code: library(fatcat) post = fitfatcat(ordered_data$y, q = 2, nit = 10000,lag = 9, burnin = 1000) beta_post = posterior::subset_draws(res, variable = "beta", regex=T) posterior::summarise_draws(beta_post)

title: Bayesian categorical factor analysis using Rcpp

what: An implementation of the factor model for categorical data — fatcat
title: An implementation of the factor model for categorical data — fatcat
text: fatcat package provides implementation factor model categorical data [Capdeville, Gonçalves Pereira (2021)]( https://doi.org/10.1080/02664763.2020.1796935)

what: Draws samples from the posterior of the factorial model for categorical data. — fitfatcat
title: Draws samples from the posterior of the factorial model for categorical data. — fitfatcat
text: Draws samples posterior factorial model categorical data.

title: Draws samples from the posterior of the factorial model for categorical data. — fitfatcat
code: fitfatcat(   y,   q,   nit,   burnin = 0,   lag = 1,   init_beta = 0.5,   init_sigma2 = 2,   C0 = 1e+05,   a = 0.001,   b = 0.001,   sdpropbeta = 0.05,   sdpropbeta2 = 0.075,   sdpropf = 0.4,   sdpropsigma2 = 0.075,   dist = c("probit"),   quiet = F,   alpha = NULL )

title: Draws samples from the posterior of the factorial model for categorical data. — fitfatcat
text: y matrix integers dimension j x n, j number variables n number observations. q integer number factors. nit integer number iterations. burnin integer number initial iterations ignored. lag integer lag iterations taken. ``lag = 1`` means take every iteration. ``lag = n`` means take one iteration every n iterations. init_beta integer initial value first column beta. init_sigma2 integer initial value sigma2. elements sigma2 vector initialized value. C0 integer variance prior beta. , b integer shape scale parameters prior sigma2. sdpropbeta integer standard deviation proposal betas unrestricted. sdpropbeta2 integer standard deviation proposal betas restricted greater equal zero. sdpropf integer standard deviation proposal factors. sdpropsigma2 integer standard deviation proposal sigma2. dist string name error distribution. Currently, `probit` accepted. quiet TRUE, prevents display progress bar. alpha vector true value alpha. Usually, starts -Inf ends +Inf.

title: Draws samples from the posterior of the factorial model for categorical data. — fitfatcat
Draws samples from the posterior of the factorial model for categorical data. — fitfatcat

what: Simulated data from the factor model for categorical data. — ordered_data
title: Simulated data from the factor model for categorical data. — ordered_data
text: Simulated data factor model categorical data.

title: Simulated data from the factor model for categorical data. — ordered_data
Simulated data from the factor model for categorical data. — ordered_data
text: ## `ordered_data` list 4 elements. y matrix dimension 5 x 300, actual simulated data. true_beta matrix dimension 5 x 2, values beta used generate data. true_sigma vector 5 elements, values sigma used generate data. true_alpha matrix dimension 5 x 5, values alpha used generate data.

what: Simulate data from a factor model for categorical ordinal data. — simulate_data
title: Simulate data from a factor model for categorical ordinal data. — simulate_data
Simulate data from a factor model for categorical ordinal data. — simulate_data
code: simulate_data(   beta,   sigma,   alpha,   n = NULL,   f = NULL,   link = c("probit", "logit") )

title: Simulate data from a factor model for categorical ordinal data. — simulate_data
text: beta matrix dimension j x q, j number variables q number latent factors. sigma vector elements diagonal matrix variances, j elements. alpha matrix dimension j x (k+1). n number observations simulated. provided `f` provided. f matrix dimension p x n. provided `n` provided. link link function used, either "probit" "logit".

title: Simulate data from a factor model for categorical ordinal data. — simulate_data
text: matrix dimension j x n, simulated data.

title: Simulate data from a factor model for categorical ordinal data. — simulate_data
text: y_i|f_i = beta f_i + epsilon_i f_i ~ N(0, I_q) : y_i vector dimension j beta matrix dimension j x q f_i vector dimension q epsilon_i vector dimension j q number factors j number variables output simulation y_i^*, categorization y_i. y_ij^* = k alpha_k-1 <= y_ij <= alpha_k number categories fixed k. k + 1 cutoff points, usually first cutoff point -infty last one +infty model can also written : y = beta beta' + Sigma known marginal model. second form model can simulated providing `n` instead `f`. now, simulating marignal model compatible probit link function.

title: Simulate data from a factor model for categorical ordinal data. — simulate_data
code: j <- 5 n <- 300 k <- 4 true_p <- 2  true_beta <- matrix(   c(     0.99, 0,     0, 0.99,     0.90, 0,     0, 0.90,     0.5, 0.5   ),   nrow = j, ncol = true_p,   byrow = TRUE )  true_sigma <- c(0.01, 0.05, 0.10, 0.15, 0.20)  true_alpha <- matrix(   c(-Inf, qnorm(0.4), qnorm(0.75), qnorm(0.9), Inf),   nrow = j, ncol = (k + 1),   byrow = TRUE )  true_f <- t(   MASS::mvrnorm(n, rep(0, true_p), diag(1, true_p, true_p)) ) y <- simulate_data(   beta = true_beta,   sigma = true_sigma,   alpha = true_alpha,   f = true_f,   link = "probit" )  y_marginal <- simulate_data(   beta = true_beta,   sigma = true_sigma,   alpha = true_alpha,   n = n,   link = "probit" )
